result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro Pozos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10/1/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro Pozos

records.addlTxt:
11:57 AM Defendant Pedro Pozos in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:

COSTS:  $243.00
D/V SURCHARGE: $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10/1/22 until paid un full, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
dated 8/5/22 from WCS re: WCS compliance report

Jury status hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

08:46 AM Attorney Carlson for attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Pedro Pozos did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense requests jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 06-01-2022 received and filed.

08:32 AM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Pedro Pozos did not appear.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Atty Wolff requests discovery in this matter. 
State reports discovery was mailed to prior counsel and will resend to Atty Wolff. 
Atty Wolff requests a new date  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 4/28/22 received and filed.
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:42 AM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Pedro Pozos did not appear.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Attorney Broze requests a new date and is waiting on discovery. State will forward Discovery to attorney forthwith.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
WCS report dated 2/25/22 re: compliance.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

08:32 AM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Pedro Pozos did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.
Atty Wolff states his client is ill today and unable to make it to court today. 
Atty Wolff states this is his motion to modify bail and makes statements as to the motion. 
State makes a statement to the court. 
Court will modify to no voilent contact. 
Defendant to come to sign the amended bond.
Date remains as set.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 2/16/22 received and filed.
